# Nicoletta Manni
Nicoletta Manni
![nicoletta Manni ok sito ph Brescia e Amisano ©Teatro alla Scala](/static/upload/nic/nicoletta-manni-ok-sito-ph-brescia-e-amisano--teatro-alla-scala.jpg)
Born in the province of Lecce, she was admitted to the La Scala Academy Ballet School at the age of 13. In 2009, after graduating, she joined the Staatsballett in Berlin directed by Vladimir Malakhov, where she remained for three seasons, dancing in all the classical and contemporary productions. In the spring of 2013 she joined the Teatro alla Scala Ballet Company and, after the appointment as Prima Ballerina in April 2014, on 8 November 2023 she was appointed Étoile of the Teatro alla Scala on stage by the CEO and Artistic Director Dominique Meyer together with the Director of La Scala Ballet Company Manuel Legris at the end of the second performance of *Onegin* by John Cranko, in which Nicoletta Manni is the protagonist in the role of Tat'jana next to Onegin by Étoile Roberto Bolle.
She dances in the productions and creations for the Company, and interprets the main roles at La Scala and during the tournée. In her repertoire: the productions of Rudolf Nureyev *Swan Lake* (Odette/Odile), *Don Quixote* (Queen of the Dryads and Kitri), *Sleeping Beauty* (Aurora and Main Fairy); by George Balanchine (*Jewels* - main couple of *Diamonds* and soloist dancer of *Rubies*; *Symphony in C* - second movement and first movement; *A Midsummer Night’s Dream* - Titania and pas de deux of the second act; *Apollo* -Tersicore; *The Nutcracker* - Sugar Plum Fairy), Alexei Ratmansky (blue couple in *Russian Seasons* and main couple in *Concerto DSCH*; *Sleeping Beauty* - Lilac Fairy and Aurora; *Swan Lake* - Odette/Odile); Roland Petit (*Pink Floyd Ballet*, *Le Jeune homme et la Mort*) Kenneth MacMillan (*Romeo and Juliet* and *L’histoire de Manon*); Heinz Spoerli (*Cello Suites* and *Goldberg Variationen*); Mauro Bigonzetti (*Cinderella* - Fairy Godmother and later Cinderella, *Progetto Händel* - main interpreter); John Cranko (*Onegin*, in the role of Tat’jana); John Neumeier (*La Dame aux camélias* - Manon and Marguerite Gautier). In addition to being the protagonist in *Giselle* (Coralli-Perrot revived by Yvette Chauviré), she danced in the role of Clara in *The Nutcracker* by Nacho Duato, the Civiltà in *Excelsior*, the creation of Massimiliano Volpini *Il giardino degli amanti*, The Dancer in Petrushka by Michail Fokin, *Petite Mort* by Jiří Kylián, Medora in *Le Corsaire* by Anna-Marie Holmes, *Woolf Works* by Wayne McGregor (*Becomings*). She danced the leading role in *Sylvia* by Manuel Legris, the opening title of the 2019/2020 Ballet Season at La Scala, *Sarcasmen* by Hans van Manen. In the Ballet Gala at La Scala (September 2020) she danced in *Carmen* (excerpts) from the ballet by Roland Petit. For the opening evening of 2020/2021 Season “A riveder le stelle”, she danced the adagio from the Grand Pas de deux of Nureyev’s *The Nutcracker*. In “Grandi momenti di danza” she’s back in the role of Kitri in the grand pas de deux from act III of *Don Quixote* and, in “Homage to Nureyev”, in the role of Dulcinea from act II of *Don Quixote* and Odile in the pas de trois from *Swan Lake*. In “Great choreographers Soirée” she dances the divertissement from *Paquita*. In “Four Choreographers Soirée” she is among the interpreters of *Movements to Stravinsky* and resumes *Concerto DSCH*. In “Contemporary Soirée” she is the protagonist of *Tristan and Isolde - pas de deux* by Krzysztof Pastor. For *La bayadère* by Rudolf Nureyev, the opening title of the 2021/2022 Season, she dances the role of Nikiya and in *Jewels* by George Balanchine she’s back in the role in the main couple of *Diamonds* and the soloist dancer of *Rubies*. In *Gala Fracci* she dances the pas de deux of the third act from *The Nutcracker* by Nureyev and the fourth movement of *Symphony in C*. For the production of Wayne McGregor *AfteRite+LORE* she is in the opening cast of the creation *LORE* and later also of *AfteRite*. She debuts in the role of Clara in *The Nutcracker* by Rudolf Nureyev, the opening title of the 2022/2023 Ballet Season. In the evening *Dawson/Duato/Kratz/Kylián* she is among the protagonists of *Anima Animus* (David Dawson) and the creation *Solitude Sometimes* (Philippe Kratz). In *Le Corsaire* by Manuel Legris she plays the role of Medora. For “William Forsythe Evening – Blake Works V” she is among the protagonists of *The Barre Project*. In the reprise of *Romeo and Juliet* by Kenneth MacMillan on June/July 2023 she back on stage in the leading role of Juliet. In September 2023 she resumes the leading role of Odette/Odile in *Swan Lake*, choreography by Rudolf Nureyev
In 2012 she won third place at the Rome Dance Prize, later the Dance&Dance Award as Interpreter for the 2014 season and was named Dancer of the Year 2014 by the online magazine giornaledelladanza.com. As the only Italian candidate for the Prix Benois de la Danse 2015, she performed at the Bolshoi Theatre and in 2015 was named “Promise” of dance by the German specialised magazine “Tanz”. She danced as a guest at the Kremlin Ballet in Moscow (*Giselle*), with Asami Maki Ballet in Tokyo (*Notre Dame de Paris* by Roland Petit), Lithuanian National Ballet in Vilnius (*Don Quixote*), with the Bolshoi Ballet in Moscow (The Dancer in *Etudes* by Harald Lander), at the Dance Open Festival Gala 2017 (St. Petersburg), Elisa y Amigos 2016 (Mexico), All Star Ballet Gala 2017 (Toronto), Yurgita Dronina Ballet world star gala 2015 (Vilnius), Season Opening Gala 2016 (Bucharest), Iana Salenko and stars of ballet 2017 (Kiev), “La notte della taranta” in Melpignano, where she performed the song by Yael Deckelbaum ‘The preyers of the mothers’, choreographed by Luciano Cannito. Ballet Gala 2018 (Warsaw), Petipa Methamorphosis XXI century 2018 (St. Petersburg), Stars of the XXI century 2018 (St. Petersburg) and since 2014 with Roberto Bolle in Roberto Bolle & Friends and in his TV shows. In September 2020 she received the award “dancer of the year on the international scene” in the forty-eighth edition of “ositano premia la danza Léonide Massin”.

Subscribers enjoy a discount ranging **from 50% to 65%** depending on the age class (Under30 if born from 1994 onwards / Under35 if born from 1989 onwards) and on the type/number of performances chosen (a **fixed series of 4 performances** or **3 shows of your choice**). Moreover, subscribers have automatic access to the [Pass](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30-35/pass-under-30-35.html) reserved area and benefits. Subscribers Under30 can also purchase the best tickets for the special [Under30 previews](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30-35/2023-2024-under30-previews.html) in advance. --- Fixed date (4 performances) The heart of the Under30/35 project are the two **fixed date series, composed by four performances** each (4 operas or 4 ballets), where you can enjoy the maximum disxount (up to 4 shows at the price of one). Moreover, before each performance in the fixed series, you are invited to a special welcome drink and introduction with the artists (until seats last). # Under30/35 Pass

LaScalaUnder30/35 Partners

With your Under30/35 Pass, you can enter our community of young enthusiasts: **the first simple step towards the Teatro alla Scala experience**. You will receive our newsletter and be kept informed on all the news and initiatives of the theatre dedicated to to young audience, taking advantage of all the exclusive offers.
The Pass costs €10 and is valid for the entire Season (from 7 December to 30 November of the following year). It can be purchased exclusively online and will be sent to you as as pdf e-ticket. Your account will be allowed to access the reserved area whithin a few minutes later.
The 2023/2024 Under30/35 Pass is reserved to people born from 1988 onwards.
The 2024/2025 Under30/35 Pass is reserved to people born from 1989 onwards and will be available from 27 September.
If you buy an Under30/35 subscription you will receive all the Pass' benefits included in your subscription.
The purchase of the Pass will give access to the Under30/35 reserved area at the link [under.teatroallascala.org](https://under.teatroallascala.org/) with many dedicated advantages:
* **35% discount** for Under35s on stalls and boxes tickets in midweek performances (Mondays-Thursdays, except series Prime, A, B, P, R) of Opera and Ballet and for all recitals (except special projects); 
* **40% discount** on stalls and boxes tickets for the evenings of the [Thursdays Under30/35 cycle](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30-35/Under30-35-thursdays.html); 
* **50% discount** on the purchase of at least 4 seats in a box with the [Together in the box](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30-35/together-in-the-box.html) offer, valid for the same dates as the -35% reduction; 
* **Special last minute promotions up to 80% discount**, subject to availability, with special invitation via newsletter; 
* **Exclusive organized tours** of the Theatre, the Theatre Museum and the Ansaldo Workshops to discover the backstage of La Scala; 
* **Open rehearsals** for operas, ballets and concerts throughout the Season for free; 
* **50% discount** on admission fee to the Theatre Museum.

# "Unveiling Inspiration": Pinterest and La Scala tell the Premiere in images
# "Unveiling Inspiration": Pinterest and La Scala tell the Premiere in images
Being on social media has been a constant feature of Teatro alla Scala's communication strategy in recent years. News about the programme, insights into the titles, images from rehearsals and backstage and recollections of La Scala’s tradition have led the Theater's channels to reach 441,500 followers on Facebook, 357,000 on Instagram and 307,000 on Twitter, while TikTok channel has been open for two years now.
On the occasion of the *Don Carlo*’s Under30 Preview and of 7 December 2023, the Theater started a new project with Pinterest, the platform dedicated to sharing images.
“[Unveiling inspiration](https://www.pinterest.it/teatroallascala/don-carlo-prima-scala-unveiling-inspiration/)” will offer Pinterest users an immersive experience of the Opening Night of the Teatro alla Scala. Through a series of videos on the platform, Pinterest will offer art lovers around the world the opportunity to take a behind-the-scenes look at the making of one of the most iconic cultural moments of the year: the Premiere. All the contents will be published on the Pinterest profile of the Teatro alla Scala, in collaboration with the Creator Valentina Raso and will be shown in the Daily inspiration Tab of the platform throughout Europe. This new series featuring Teatro alla Scala demonstrates Pinterest's ongoing commitment to bringing extraordinary content to the more than 480 million users who turn to the platform for inspiration every month.

# Partners of the Theatre Museum
# Partners of the Theatre Museum
Each year, over 250,000 tourists from all over the world visit La Scala’s Theatre Museum, a recorded history of the prestigious La Scala opera house from its beginnings to the present day. The museum’s elegant spaces, with their collections of musical instruments, portraits and original documents, are home to important works of art, and photography and costume displays are hosted here on a regular basis.
As Partners of the Theatre Museum and their Temporary Exhibitions, companies have the unique opportunity to associate their name to the history of Teatro alla Scala.

## Ticket Carnets
[Read more](/en/season/box-office/subscriptions/ticket-carnets.html)
### How to renew
**From 29 May to 19 September,** subscribers of the 2023/2024 Season will be granted the possibility to renew their subscription for the same seat without additional presale fees.
**Renewal channels**
* **Online**, directly from your user page after logging in to your account in the [webshop](https://teatroallascala.vivaticket.it) 
* By **email**, by writing to [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) with payment: 
 * by **credit card,** attach a front/back copy of the card and a signed authorization to charge the renewal amount 
 * by **bank transfer**, attach a receipt of the transfer to "Fondazione Teatro alla Scala - Ufficio Biglietteria", IBAN IT60E0306903390100000000046, BIC/SWIFT code BCITITMM988. 
* By **phone**, calling the +39 02 99901922 (Mon-Sat, 10-18): payment by voucher or credit card. 
* At the **Box Office** (open from Monday to Saturday, from 12 noon to 6pm), payment by cash, card, voucher or cheque.
**Shipment**
Subscriptions can be issued as PDF e-ticket or in paper format. In the latter case, they will be shipped by registered mail starting from October, or can be collected at the Box Office from September.
**Note**
Subscription renewal and payment can be done only by the title holder or by a delegated person.
### New subscriptions
**From 29 May**, fixed-date subscriptions for the new Season will be available for sale for all the seats not subject to the renewal right by previous subscribers. Carnets and Libero subscriptions will be available later, from **27 September**.
New subscriptions can be purchased:
* **Online**, directly from our [webshop](https://tickets.teatroallascala.org/en/abbonamenti) 
* by **email**, writing to [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) 
* at the **Box Office** (open Mon-Sat, 12-18).
A maximum of 6 seats can be purchased by each subscriber. Entire boxes have to be booked in subscription (except for Under30/35 formulas and for Ticket Carnets).
**Shipment**
Subscriptions are issued as PDF e-ticket or in paper format. In the latter case, they will be shipped by registered mail starting from October, or can be collected at the Box Office from September.
**Note**
Subscription renewal and payment can be done only by the title holder or by a dellegated person.
### Subscription benefits
**Reduction**
Subscribers enjoy 20% reduction with respect to single ticket prices.
**Priority Seating Selection**
Until 19 September 2024, subscribers may exercise the right to reserve their current seat for the upcoming season without any increase of the price.
**Purchase tickets in advance at special price**
Opera, Prime Opera, Balleto, Prime Balletto, Mini, Weekend, Sinfonica subscribers have the possibility to buy tickets in advance and with a 10% discount for the performances of the Season, online from the dedicated page of webshop of Teatro alla Scala (sent periodically by newsletter) or by telephone at the dedicated number +39 0299901922 (Monday to Saturday from 10am to 6pm).
The presale is available:
* **from 7 October 2024** for operas *La forza del destino, Falstaff, Die Walküre, Evgenij Onegin, Tosca, L'opera seria, Il nome della rosa, Trittico Kurt Weill* and ballets *Lo Schiaccianoci, Kratz / Preljocaj / De Bana, Peer Gynt**;* 
* **from 8 January 2025** for operas *Siegfried, Norma, La Cenerentola, Rigoletto, La Fille du régiment, Così fan tutte* and balelts *Paquita, Swan Lake, Aspects of Nijinsky, Serata Forsythe / The Blake works*..
Every subscription gives the opportunity to buy 1 ticket for every title.
7th December Opening Night and Under30 previews are not included.
**Additional subscriptions at a discounted price
Opera** and **Prime Opera** subscribers are entitled to a **10% discount** if they add one or more Mini and Ballet season tickets to their subscription.
These purchases are available only at the Theatre Box Office.
**Date Change Service**
Prime, Opera, Ballet, Mini, Weekend and Symphonic subscribers, should they be unable to attend a performance on the allotted date, can take advantage of the **“date change service” for the same production and sector**, upon availability.
Date Change can be done directly online for free in your [Reserved Area ](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/login.html).
Alternatevely, above mentioned Subscribers (excluded Under 30 and 30/35) can ask for date change serve also by email and telephone, at the price of € 10 for opera and ballet performances and € 5 for concerts, with request within 48 hours from the date of the premiere of the production (specifying both the allotted date and the requested date change):
* by email to **[[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#0162606c63686e6560756041676e6f65607b686e6f646d607262606d602f6875);** 
* by telephone at the dedicated number +39 0299901922 (Monday to Saturday from 10am to 7pm).
After a change of date, subscribers cannot regain their original seat.
Date changes cannot be requested by subscribers of the Cultural Promotion Service. Subscribers to boxes can only request a date change for the entire box.
**Additional services for subscribers**
* Complimentary program booklets (only for Opera, Prime Opera and Prime Ballet subscribers - a booklet for pair of subscriptions) 
* 8585 Taxi booking service 
* -35% Card for parking in Piazza Meda 
* Free entrance at Museo Teatrale alla Scala 
* Complimentary Ticket holder and Agenda 
* Online advanced booking services for food and drinks at the Theatre bars 
* Reserved price (70€ instead of 100€) for LaScalaTv’s 2024 annual subscription
**For further information**
Infotel: +39 0272003744 / [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#e08c819383818c81928993908f8e8485a0868f8e84819a898f8e858c819383818c81ce8994)
Dedicated subscribers service: +39 0299901922 / [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#c4a5a6a6abaaa5a9a1aab0ab84a2abaaa0a5beadabaaa1a8a5b7a7a5a8a5eaadb0)
### Guidelines
1. Subscriptions can be taken out or renewed only by the holder or by a person delegated by the holder.
2. Subscribers will receive a ticket for each seat included in the subscription.
3. Subscriptions are personal and not transferable. For companies the Teatro alla Scala suggest the ["Corporate"](/en/support-us/companies/corporate-subscriptions.html) Subscriptions.
4. Subscribers who fail to attend on the date scheduled for their event forfeit any right with respect to that performance. Subscribers’ seats will be kept free and will not be used by the Theatre. Subscribers are entitled to request a date change, which can be done directly online in your [Reserved Area](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/login.html) or requested by mail to [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#24474549464d4b4045504564424b4a40455e4d4b4a41484557474548450a4d50) or by phone to +39 02 999 019 22, at least 48 hours before the date of the performance. The online data change service is free. The telephone or email service has a cost, for any seating area, is of € 10 for Operas and Ballets and € 5 for Concerts and is confirmed only when the operator answers the request. The management reserves the right to allocate new seats and to use those unoccupied by subscribers, subject to availability. Date changes to opening and reserved performances are not possible. Date changes are not possible for Cultural Promotion Service subscriptions. "Under" subscription can only change online.
 Subscribers in boxes can only request the change of date for the entire box.
5. Performances of particular artistic interest may be broadcast on television. The management reserves the right to move some seats in subscriptions for technical reasons.
6. In the event of absolute necessity, the management reserves the right to alter the cast and to change dates or types of performance previously advertised in the programme.
For more information on services reserved to subscribers check the dedicated section above, call the Infotel Service on +39 02 72 00 37 44 or email [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#aec2cfddcdcfc2cfdcc7dddec1c0cacbeedacbcfdadcc1cfc2c2cfddcdcfc2cf80c1dcc9)[t](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#8ae6ebf9e9ebe6ebf8e3f9fae5e4eeefcaece5e4eeebf0e3e5e4efe6ebf9e9ebe6eba4e3fe).

# Partners of the tours
# Partners of the tours
La Scala is famous the world over for its exceptional artistic standards, thanks to an extensive tour schedule that includes performances in some of the best-known theatres in Italy and abroad.
La Scala’s international vocation began on its one-hundredth birthday. In 1878, the Orchestra of La Scala gave a series of concerts at the Trocadéro in Paris for the Universal Exposition. In the last 140 years, Teatro alla Scala organized 156 international tours with 872 curtain openings.
Sponsoring a tour is the perfect way to associate your company with La Scala’s international reputation. From Argentina to Japan, the US to China, La Scala will carry your brand across the world, to some of the greatest capital cities.
**For information**
Francesca Agus

# Special artistic projects
# Special artistic projects
Each year, in every La Scala season, the Theatre’s Marketing Department works in collaboration with new partners on special projects tied to an event or a cycle of artistic events.
Projects may be oriented around the celebration of a special occasion and/or anniversary, a mean of developing co-marketing and PR activities, repositioning brands or promoting unique aspects common to two apparently different but actually interconnected fields by virtue of their shared values.

# Time
On the first day of sales, tickets will be available **from 10 am online on [teatroallascala.vivaticket.it](https://teatroallascala.vivaticket.it/) and at the Theatre Box Office**.
The staff of the Associazione l'Accordo will be on hand to manage the list and the queue in Largo Ghiringhelli.
Tickets for Under30 Previews, not purchased in pre-emption by Under30 Subscribers, are on sale from 10am online only. "Invitation to La Scala" performances and those reserved to schools are on sale exclusively through the Cultural Promotion Service.
For any doubts, please consult the [Sales calendar](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/box-office/tickets-prices/sales-calendar.html).

# Technical sponsors
# Technical sponsors
La Scala’s Technical Sponsors contribute in terms of their expertise, their professional and technical know-how and services, to keep the Theatre in a constant state of renewal.
Technical Sponsors may style themselves “Technical Sponsor of La Scala” in their communications and marketing and are listed as Technical Sponsors in our Season Calendar (approx. 150,000 copies) and programs (approx. 200,000 copies).
La Scala’s Marketing Department will work with you to design a specific proposal for your sector of activity and the size of your investment.

### Registration of personal details and ticket naming 
**The registration of your name and surname, mailing and e-mail address, telephone number, date of birth is mandatory before you can proceed with your first purchase, however, this only needs to be done once.**
**For any purchases made through the Box Office, you will be required to show an identity document and to give your personal customer code, which can be obtained by registering:** 
\- at the Theatre Box Office using the dedicated electronic stands;
\- online at [www.logscala.org](http://www.logscala.org) (accessible also from mobile devices); you will then receive your customer code by e-mail.
**Following registration, all tickets are registered in the name of the purchaser.** 
If a ticket is used by a person other than the buyer, the latter is required to issue a written proxy to the user, which must be performance at the entrance to the theatre together with the ticket and a copy of the buyer’s valid ID document. The **proxy form** is available from the Theatre Box Office (also at the time of purchase), or can be downloaded [here](https://bko.teatroallascala.org/static/upload/pro/proxy-theatre-box-office.pdf).
If the buyer has purchased more than one ticket in his/her name, the presentation of a proxy is only necessary if the buyer will not be attending the performance.
In case the ticket is resold from the [**official Teatro alla Scala resale page**](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/official-resale-teatro-alla-scala-tickets.html), the original ticket will be annulled and refunded by bank transfer to the owner (with a 10% deduction for service fees) and a new ticket – for the same seat and value – will be issued and sent to the new purchaser, with his name on it.
The Theatre reserves the right to verify the buyer’s identity before granting entry into the theatre by requesting ticket holders to present an identity document and the relevant proxy (if necessary): this is done to check the truthfulness of the data printed on the ticket, the correspondence between the person carrying the ticket and its registered buyer, and also the regularity of the sales service, ensuring that the ticket purchase process is not compromised or that any other ticket regulations are not violated. If the aforementioned verification fails, the Teatro alla Scala Foundation and Ticketone S.p.A. reserves the right to cancel the tickets in question and to deny access to the ticket holder; the Theatre also reserves the right to forbid the sale of tickets for the current and upcoming seasons to customers implicated in irregular ticket purchases.
### Ticket validity
**Tickets cannot be cancelled, replaced or refunded.**
**Tickets are only valid for the date, time and place indicated thereon, it is therefore recommended that you check whether these details are correct at the time of purchase.**
Tickets must be presented intact and in their original form; they are valid for a single entrance and cannot be reused after they have been validated at the first access check point into the Theatre.
In the case of non-use or of the customer’s failure to attend a performance, tickets cannot be shifted to another date.
In the case of loss or theft, the buyer must fill in and hand in a self-declaration of ticket loss or theft to the Theatre Box Office no later than 2 hours before the start of the performance, together with a copy of his/her identity document.
In the event of live filming, for artistic purposes or reasons beyond its control, the Theatre reserves the right to make seat changes, allotting customers affected seats of equivalent or higher category (based on availability), or offering them similar seats for an alternative date. This does not however constitute grounds for a refund.
The Theatre Direction reserves the right to make changes to the cast for artistic purposes or reasons beyond its control, but this does not entail the right to a refund of the ticket price. The Theatre will communicate such changes in advance on its website and, when possible, by e-mail.
### Cancellation of performances and refund methods 
**Refunds will be processed only in case of a date variation or the cancellation of a performance.**
Should the date of a performance be changed or a performance be cancelled for any reason, ticket holders are entitled to a full refund of the ticket price, that is the amount indicated on the coupon, including any pre-sale fee, without prejudice to any of the consumer rights recognised by the law; refunds may be requested within 30 days of the changed / cancelled performance date, without prejudice to any other of the consumer rights recognised by the law.
**Refund methods:** 
1. for tickets purchased online, the amount will automatically be credited to the ticket holder’s account by the end of the month following the date of the performance; 
2. for tickets purchased at the Theatre Box Office, the amount will be credited by bank transfer following the handing-in of the original coupon and bank details (IBAN and, in case of residence or foreign current account, BIC / SWIFT) to the Box Office; 
3. for subscriptions, the refund of the unused portion of the season ticket will be effected by bank transfer.
**Any further information regarding the canceled events and the relative extraordinary reimbursement procedures** will be communicated by email to the holders of tickets and season tickets and published on www.teatroallascala.org.
### Offical Resale of Teatro alla Scala Tickets
In case you are unable to attend a performance purchased online on our website, it is possible to officially **propose your tickets for resale** on the [**official Teatro alla Scala resale page**](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/official-resale-teatro-alla-scala-tickets.html), in a safe and transparent procedure in compliance with the [Italian law on secondary ticketing](https://www.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/web/guest/provvedimento-del-27-giugno-2019).
**This website is the only official resale channel for Teatro alla Scala tickets: do not buy from other unauthorized secondary ticket websites.**
**Resale terms and conditions**
The resale service applies only to:
* single tickets (no subscriptions, gift codes, carnets, pass, discounted tickets) purchased **ONLINE, on the Teatro alla Scala website, at **INTERO (full) fare****; 
* for selected opera, ballet and concert performances, where the resale button or banner is shown on the website; 
* **within 72 hours** from the beginning of the performance.
**The sale proposal must be made by the ticket purchaser, logging in with the same account used to purchase the ticket.**
To check if a ticket is eligible for the resale proposal, log in to your [**reserved area**](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/login.html): you will see a red “**Resell**” button next to the ticket details in your “**My tickets**” purchase history.
The resale procedure is activate for one single ticket at a time. By repeating the operation, you can then propose the other tickets for resale as well.
The ticket must be offered at the **purchase price**: the sale will be completed only when a **new buyer** confirms the transaction by buying it online on the official resale platform.
Please note that the resale proposal is binding in case a new buyer is found. However, until a buyer is found, the proposal can be [](https://teatroallascala.vivaticket.it/en/myresales)**[withdrawn anytime in the dedicated page](https://tickets.teatroallascala.org/it/myresales)**.
In case the resale is completed, the resold ticket will be immediately cancelled and refunded to the seller (by **bank transfer**, within the end of the following month, with a **10% deduction for commission fees**) and a new ticket will be issued, registered to the new buyer.
The success of the resale is communicated by email to the two parties, that do not need to be in contact with each other. In this way, the procedure is entirely compliant with data protection provisions.
Please note that Teatro alla Scala is not responsible for any incomplete resale due to the lack of an interested buyer, any downtimes of the website or internet connection problems or any misconduct on the reseller side.
The service is reserved to occasional, non-professional users, as a ticket exchange instrument for final consumers. By reselling a ticket, the user must verify that no contractual norm or obligation is violated. The reseller remains liable for any misconducts in this sense.
It is also responsibility of the reseller to [**check if the resale was successful**](https://teatroallascala.vivaticket.it/en/myresales), which means the tickets are now invalidated and refunded. If no buyer was found within 72 hours before the beginning of the performance, the resale is incomplete, as the service ends 72 hours prior to the beginning of the performance.
### Other instructions
* The sales of Teatro alla Scala tickets by unauthorized persons is prohibited. No retailer may be in possession of tickets before the official sale date of the events. Furthermore, tickets cannot be resold at a price higher than that indicated on the ticket itself for profit and, in particular, in violation of the provisions of paragraphs 545 and 546 of art. 1 of Law 232/2016 and related implementing legislation on the sale of tickets on the secondary market (secondary ticketing); the Teatro alla Scala reserves the right to report any relevant facts to the competent authorities Authority.
* **The Teatro alla Scala takes no responsibility for the characteristics, quality and price of tickets purchased through unauthorized sales channels.**
* In the event that it is ascertained that a ticket or subscription has been purchased through unofficial channels or unauthorized parties, or that the ticket or subscription has been duplicated or obtained in conflict with these Regulations, admission to the theatre will be denied.
* **Tickets to Teatro alla Scala performances may not be used for commercial, advertising or other promotional purposes** (e.g. they cannot be offered as prizes in competitions) except when prior written authorization has been provided by the Fondazione Teatro alla Scala.
* **Customers are not allowed to linger at the Box Office** for longer than the time necessary to conclude a purchase. **Photo and video recordings of personell at work are not allowed**, except with previous authorisation.
* These Regulations are also available on the Teatro alla Scala website www.teatroallascala.org. Should these Regulations be updated, the version published on the website – or, in any case, the one which is more favorable to customers – prevails.

### Limited view Balcony seats
For most performances (excluding previews, children shows, guest events), the Theater offers numbered tickets for seats with reduced visibility, usually at the special price of 10 euro.
These tickets are sold exclusively on the day of the performance: in first priority by registering to a **queue list** managed by “L’ACCORDO” Association, officially in charge on behalf of the Theatre, and secondly **online for remaining tickets** on [tickets.teatroallascala.org](http://tickets.teatroallascala.org).
Sale procedure with queue at the Theatre:
1. **LIST REGISTRATION**: every interested spectator must be present in the official queue in Via Filodrammatici and show their identity document and Scala registration number. If it is the first time purchasing, please register to [www.logscala.org](http://www.logscala.org) before. No other list, drafted by unauthorised persons, will be taken into consideration. 
2. **ROLL CALL AND LIST CLOSURE**: people on the list are called a second time in Via Filodrammatici to reform a queue according to the list order. Spectators who do not respond to the call lose priority in the queue. *The list is closed approximately two hours before the beginning of the performances*. 
3. **PURCHASE**: after the closure of the list, “L’ACCORDO” staff members will take each spectator (according to the list order) to the Box Office to purchase 1 ticket per person. To facilitate the operations, it is possible to jointly pay for 2 tickets, on behalf of at most one other person on the list.

Opera, Prime Opera, Balleto, Prime Balletto, Mini, Weekend, Sinfonica subscribers have the possibility to buy tickets in advance and with a 10% discount for the performances of the next Season, online from their [Reserved Area](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/login.html) or by telephone at the dedicated number **+39 0299901922** (Monday to Saturday from 10am to 6pm).

These purchases are available only at the Theatre Box Office.
**Date Change Service**
Prime, Opera, Ballet, Mini, Weekend and Symphonic subscribers - should they be unable to attend a performance on the allotted date - can take advantage of the **“date change service” for the same production and sector**, upon availability.
Date Change can be done directly online for free in your [Reserved Area](https://www.teatroallascala.org/it/login.html).
Alternatevely, above mentioned Subscribers (excluded Under 30 and 30/35) can ask for date change serve also by email and telephone, at the price of € 10 for opera and ballet performances and € 5 for concerts, with request within 48 hours from the date of the premiere of the production (specifying both the allotted date and the requested date change):
* by email to **[[email protected]](http://cambiodata@fondazionelascala.it);** 
* by telephone at the dedicated number +39 02 99901922 (Monday to Saturday from 10am to 7pm).
After a change of date, subscribers cannot regain their original seat.
Date changes cannot be requested by subscribers of the Cultural Promotion Service. Subscribers to boxes can only request a date change for the entire box.

* **Taxi Booking**: at the end of performances, subscription holders can ask theatre staff to call a taxi (registered with the 8585 service) and will be given priority over other customers (according to the request order). 
* **“Best in Parking” Card**: discount card of 35% to be used at the automatic cash machines at the exit of the Theatre’s partnered parking garage in Piazza Meda, with access from Corso Matteotti.

Any further information regarding the canceled shows and extraordinary reimbursement methods will be communicated by email to the holders of season tickets.
For companies, the Teatro alla Scala offers a choice of Corporate Subscriptions (page).
Should a subscription be used for profit or in violation of these Regulations, the Teatro alla Scala reserves the right to deny admission to the Theatre to those involved and to refuse any refund.
## Additional information
### House rules
All members of the audience must be in possession of a ticket (intact in its original printed format or in electronic form on a smartphone or device) or season-ticket card (intact in its original printed format), which must be kept available for inspection at all times and must be shown upon request to the Theatre staff. Members of the audience are required to occupy the seats allocated to them.
The doors of the theater open 45 minutes before the start of the performance.
Access to the auditorium is not permitted once the performance has started (with the exception of ticket holders with seats in boxes, who may enter their box even after the performance has started).
Latecomers will be asked to wait in the Foyer until the first break in the performance before taking their seats. The performance is screened live on screens in the Foyer (this service is offered free to viewers).
**Children**
Should a child disturb other members of the audience, the child and the accompanying adult will be kindly invited to watch the rest of the performance on the screens in the Foyer. In this regard, it is advisable to choose box or balcony seats for children to facilitate their exit from the theatre if necessary and avoid disturbing other viewers while doing so.
The Teatro alla Scala recommends that families with children take advantage of the Theatre’s Opera performances and Concerts staged specifically for them.
**Dress code**
The public is kindly requested to dress appropriately, out of respect for Theatre and for other viewers. People wearing tank tops or shorts will not be allowed inside the Theatre and will not be entitled to a refund of the ticket price.
**Loss or theft of tickets**
In the case of loss or theft of tickets, the customer must fill in and hand in a self-declaration of loss or theft to the Theatre Box Office no later than 2 hours before the start of the performance, together with a copy of his/her identity document.
**Cloakroom**
The cloakroom service is free of charge. Audience members should leave all bulky items, umbrellas, hats, bags, cameras, audio and video recording equipment as well as overcoats and coats at the cloakroom. The stalls and balconies have supervised cloakrooms and each box has its own small backroom.
**Behaviour**
Audience members are requested to behave appropriately at all times and to remain silent throughout the performance.
The use of mobile phones in the auditorium is forbidden.
It is forbidden to take photographs or to make any type of audio or video recording.
According to Italian Law (584/75) smoking is forbidden on the Theatre premises.
Food and drinks can be consumed only in the Theatre’s bar areas or in the Foyer.
It is forbidden to introduce glasses and food of any kind into the auditorium.
**Facilitated access**
For spectators with mobility impairments, access to the stalls is facilitated by ramps and there is a specially equipped bathroom on the same level. Access to the balconies is possible via special stairways and an elevator that goes directly from the stalls to the first and second balconies. Boxes are not served by elevators. For safety reasons, wheelchairs cannot access the boxes and the balconies.
**Subtitles**
The Theatre provides (free of charge) a text display of the libretto of the performance, with a multilingual translation. These electronic librettos are placed in front of the seats; they can be turned off if preferred and do not disturb nearby spectators in any way. For all performances of the Season there are English and Italian versions, while in the case of French, German or Spanish operas, the text in the original language is also made available.
Please note that for logistical and / or technical reasons, not all seats are provided with text displays. 
Subtitles can be followed also on any smartphone device, with the “Libretto Scala” App, downloadable for free here:
* [Android version](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.libretto42.app) 
* [iPhone iOS version ](https://apps.apple.com/it/app/libretto-scala/id1623322004)
In the case of malfunctioning of the device, spectators are not entitled to any compensation.
**Programmes**
Programmes are available from Theatre staff during each performance. The sale price is € 20 for the opening opera and € 15 for subsequent productions, € 10 for ballet productions and € 5 for concerts.

# Partners and official suppliers
# Partners and official suppliers
La Scala’s Official Partners work with the theatre to create dialogue founded on the acknowledgement of our respective areas of expertise and our shared common values.
Guided by this principle, our ‘Official Partners’, who are often also ‘Official Suppliers’, support and promote the Season’s productions at La Scala, to create sustainable and lasting projects that will become a key element in their own corporate communications.
Day in, day out, our Official Partners demonstrate their ability to exceed the boundaries of everyday business and embrace an active role, conscious as they are of their corporate social responsibility.
**For information**

# Rolex
# Rolex
Like Rolex, Teatro Alla Scala makes magic. While the brand dazzles the world with its admirable timepieces, La Scala mesmerizes us with music that reverberates through this historic performance hall appreciated worldwide. Steeped in tradition and graced by the globe’s legendary artists, La Scala represents perfection in the arts.
As purveyors of perfection, we are proud to be associated with this formidable venue as its Official Timekeeper, having supported the finest musicians, conductors and opera singers in the world for over fifty years. Among them, renowned tenor Placido Domingo, a Rolex Testimonee for over 30 years, gave a special concert supported by us in December 2009 at La Scala, to celebrate 40 years of performance there.
For Rolex, time is music. And for a theatre that passes its time making exceptional music, the partnership between the two makes perfect sense. We look forward to a lasting alliance with Teatro Alla Scala based on shared values and a passion for excellence.
**Arnaud Boetsch**

## 
La Scala organizes a new series of special nights (the **Under30/35 Thursdays**) with dedicated seats and prices for attenders under 36 years old.
Each of these nights is introduced with a free happy-hour, approximately 45 minutes before the beginning of the show.
It is possible to purchase single performances (40% off, from the [Reserved Area](https://under.teatroallascala.org/) of [Pass](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30-35/pass-under-30-35.html) holders) or a carnet/subscription to at least 3 dates (to enjoy a further discount up to 50%).
Tickets for **single performances** are on sale when the production opens for sale.
“Build-your-own” **carnets** for 3 performances in 2024 are on sale from 29 September 2023.
“Build-your-own” **subscriptions** for 3 performances in 2025 are on sale from 27 September 2024.

# Partner Tournée
# Partner Tournée
L’elevato valore artistico della Scala è riconosciuto nel mondo grazie anche all’intensa attività di Tournée in Italia e all’estero, nelle sale e nei teatri più famosi.
La vocazione internazionale della Scala ha inizio con le celebrazioni dei 100 anni della sua nascita. Nel 1878, infatti, l’orchestra della Scala tenne una serie di concerti al Trocadero di Parigi in occasione dell’Esposizione Universale. Negli ultimi 140 anni, il Teatro alla Scala ha organizzato in totale 156 progetti di tournée internazionali, con 872 aperture di sipario.
Con la sponsorizzazione di una Tournée potrete legare il nome della vostra azienda al prestigio internazionale del Teatro. Dall’Argentina al Giappone, dagli Stati Uniti alla Cina, la Scala porterà il vostro brand ovunque nel mondo nelle più importanti capitali.

# Sponsor tecnici
# Sponsor tecnici
Gli Sponsor Tecnici del Teatro alla Scala offrono la propria eccellenza mettendo a disposizione il loro know-how tecnico-professionale e i loro servizi, per rendere continuo il processo di rinnovamento del Teatro.
Se diventerete Sponsor Tecnici, potrete utilizzare il titolo di ‘Sponsor Tecnico del Teatro alla Scala’ per la vostra attività di comunicazione e sarete citati come ‘Sponsor Tecnico’ nel calendario di stagione (200.000 copie circa) e nei programmi di sala (100.000 copie circa).
La Direzione Marketing del Teatro costruirà con voi proposte specifiche in funzione del vostro settore di attività e della dimensione dell’investimento.

# Great performances for children
# Great performances for children
Every year since 2015, Teatro alla Scala has presented a special program with the most celebrated titles of the opera repertoire, translated and abridged for the occasion into language suited to children. In recent years, the project has been attended by hundreds of thousands of children, paying a symbolic ticket price of 1 euro to enjoy the shows both during the week on school trips, and the weekend with their families.
The Theatre offers also A series of performances-concerts specifically thought for the youngest audience and their families, with scripts and direction by Mario Acampa. Lalla & Skali characters guide children through a special adventure filled with sounds, instruments and fantastic stories, with the music and the voices from the Teatro alla Scala and La Scala Academy artists.

# Under30 Previews
# Under30 Previews
Sponsor:
LaScalaUnder30/35 Partners
[
![Logo Intesa Sanpaolo](/static/upload/int/intesa-san-paolo-sfondo-bianco-77px.png "Intesa Sanpaolo")
](https://www.intesasanpaolo.com/)[
![Logo Idealista](/static/upload/ide/idealista-con-sfondo-bianco-77px.png "Idealista")
](https://www.idealista.it/)
If you are aged up to and including thirty, you can experience the magic of a Preview of the two opening nights of the La Scala seasons (Opera and Ballet), totally reserved to young people and with a very special price.
* 4 December 2024, Opera [*La forza del destino*](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/2024-2025/opera/la-forza-del-destino-under30-preview.html) 
* 17 December 2024, Ballet [*The Nutcracker*](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/2024-2025/ballet/The-Nutcracker-under30-preview.html)
This exclusive event is the first of many opportunities in the Season that La Scala reserves for Under30/35s with the season [Pass and Subscriptions](https://www.teatroallascala.org/en/season/box-office/young-people-and-promotions/la-scala-under30/la-scala-under30-35.html).
**Under30 Subscribers have an opportunity to purchase one ticket for both Previews in advance from 21 October 2024 at 12.**
Applicants under 18 years of age must compile [the disclaimer](/static/upload/lib/liberatoria.pdf), which can be downloaded from the website, and consign it to the box office.
How to purchase
The single price for a ticket to the Preview is €20.
It is not necessary to be in possession of a Pass or Season Ticket to attend a Preview.
**For all UNDER30s**
* Tickets not purchased in pre-emption by Under30 Subscribers can be purchased exclusively online at [tickets.teatroallascala.org](https://tickets.teatroallascala.org) from **10am on the 29 October 2024** for *La forza del destino* and **from 10 am on the 30 October 2024** for *The Nutcracker*. 
* In both cases, you may purchase a maximum of 2 tickets and the person accompanying you must not be older than 30 years of age at the moment of the performance. 
* A document (ID, passport, etc.) certifying your age should be exhibited to the Ushers for admission to the Theatre.
**For Under30 Subscription holders**
If you hold an Under30 Subscription (different from a Pass), you will have an opportunity to purchase tickets for all the Previews in advance, subject to availability of seats. Every subscriber is entitled to book one ticket for each preview in the reserved area, starting from 21 October 2024.

# La Scala Under30 and the 30/35 project
# La Scala Under30 and the 30/35 project
During the Season 2009-2010 Teatro alla Scala launched the “La Scala UNDER30” project, aimed at approaching young people giving them the opportunity to get closer to the Theatre thanks to specific initiatives:
* with the Previews, people under the age of 30 are given the opportunity to attend the performances that inaugurate the Opera and Ballet seasons in special previews dedicated to them at the symbolic price of 20 euro; 
* the PassUNDER30 moves a further step towards loyalty: at just 10 euros per year, audience members can become part of the LaScalaUNDER30 Community and enjoy access to all the dedicated initiatives like guided tours of the Theatre, backstage areas, Workshops, as well as free access to rehearsals or reserved promotions; 
* UNDER30 Season subscriptions allow the young public to become a faithful spectator of Teatro alla Scala, purchasing 4 shows for the price of one and enjoying the opportunity to participate in encounters with the artists and happy hours before each performance.
For the 2022-2023 Season, Teatro alla Scala worked on a new project for young people that are “growing out of” the UNDER30 concessions, with dedicated initiatives and offers that can accompany them up to the age of 35, continuing their educational path of training and loyalty as true “La Scala” aficionados.
## Intesa SanPaolo
Sulla base del principio di “responsabilità civica”, che rappresenta uno dei suoi valori fondanti, Intesa Sanpaolo realizza i propri interventi nell’area culturale coniugando l’impegno in attività direttamente promosse con quello per iniziative in partnership, in modo da sviluppare un sostegno attivo nella promozione culturale al fianco di enti di grande rilevanza formativa, scientifica e artistica.
In questo ambito si conferma il pluriennale sostegno al progetto La Scala UNDER30, dedicato ai giovani e nato dalla volontà di avvicinare un pubblico sempre più vasto alla cultura musicale.
È un'impronta che fa parte del DNA e del patrimonio culturale di Intesa Sanpaolo, chiave originale per sviluppare nuove idee e progettualità al servizio del Paese e una testimonianza concreta di fiducia nelle nuove generazioni.
![IntesaSanPaolo](/static/upload/int/intesasanpaolo.jpg)
## Fondazione Banca del Monte di Lombardia
“We are happy to confirm that our shared initiative with La Scala is a constructive response to our objectives at the Fondazione Banca del Monte di Lombardia. In the arts and culture sector, as in others, our aim and our vocation is to promote high-value paths of action that function as a driving force for development”, says **Aldo Poli**, FBML.
Since 2006, the foundation has forged a new relationship with the Teatro alla Scala in the form of a concept for young people, who represent the future of the theatre and other performance forms. The “La ScalaUNDER30” programme offers young people an opportunity to become better acquainted with cultural and artistic values.
With the project "Great Performances for Children", special discounts on opera and ballet tickets for young people, the UNDER30 card and young people’s previews, the Fondazione Banca del Monte di Lombardia helps young people take their first steps towards discovery of the stage arts, together with their families.

# Roberto Bolle
# Roberto Bolle
## 
**Primo ballerino étoile**
Formatosi alla Scuola del Teatro alla Scala di Milano, di cui è étoile dal 2004, ha danzato in tutti i maggiori teatri del mondo e con le compagnie più prestigiose, tra le quali l’American Ballet Theatre, il Balletto dell’Opéra di Parigi, il Balletto del Bol’šoj e del Mariinskij-Kirov, il Royal Ballet.
Il 1° giugno 2002 ha danzato al Golden Jubilee della Regina Elisabetta, a Buckingham Palace. L'evento è stato trasmesso in Mondovisione dalla BBC.
Il 1° Aprile 2004 ha danzato al cospetto di Sua Santità Giovanni Paolo II sul sagrato di Piazza San Pietro, a Roma, per la giornata della Gioventù.
Nel febbraio 2006 ha preso parte alla cerimonia di apertura, trasmessa in Mondovisione, dei Giochi Olimpici Invernali di Torino.
Dopo il successo di pubblico e critica riscosso al suo esordio al Met di New York nel 2007, dove ha danzato con Alessandra Ferri per l’addio alle scene della étoile, è entrato a far parte dell’American Ballet Theatre in qualità di Principal Dancer - titolo mai finora assegnato ad un danzatore uomo italiano - a partire dalla stagione 2009.
Nominato nel 2009 “Young Global Leader” dal World Economic Forum di Davos, Bolle dal 1999 è “Ambasciatore di buona volontà” per l’UNICEF, organizzazione per la quale partecipa a una serie numerosa e significativa di iniziative.
Nel 2012 è stato insignito del prestigioso titolo di "Cavaliere dell'Ordine al Merito della Repubblica Italiana" conferitogli dal Presidente della Repubblica, Giorgio Napolitano, in virtù dei meriti acquisiti verso il Paese in campo culturale.

# Rusalka and the “new world” of Dvořák harmonies
# Rusalka and the “new world” of Dvořák harmonies
## The Czech director Tomáš Hanus debuts at La Scala with the masterpiece by Antonín Dvořák, a score with the most exquisite musical fabric
![Rusalka (5)](/static/upload/rus/rusalka--5-.jpg)
Undine, naiad, nymph. If you search “Rusalka” in a Czech dictionary, it’s immediately clear who the subject of one of the greatest classics of Bohemian theatre is. Early Romanticism held in high regard these forest nymphs that live in water and attract mortals to try and pull them under. Eager to leave the mark of his genius on opera, Antonín Dvořák brought the ancient legend back to life, performing it triumphantly in Prague in 1901. A new production for La Scala Theatre, which will be on stage from June 6-22, its direction was entrusted to Emma Dante and conducting to Tomáš Hanus, musical director of the Welsh National Opera, which debuted at the Wiener Staatsoper with Rusalka in 2017 and returned many times to the Bayerische Staatsoper.
VC Maestro, as a respected interpreter of the Bohemian school, what link do you have with composers like Dvořák and Janáček?
TH Although it brings up memories from my childhood, I don’t like to be defined as a specialist of this repertoire. I prefer to be considered a great conductor. Nevertheless, I recognize there is an affinity between me and these artists, and not just for our similar origins. In their works, which are as enjoyable as they are timeless, there is a unique combination of lyrical talent and a strong unburdened craftsmanship. Rusalka reaches unparalleled heights of melodic eloquence. It lives in an enchanted musical landscape steeped in timbral whimsy. But they are also pure in truth because hiding behind the fairy tale is the subtle discrepancy between animate and inanimate beings, between longed-for and unattained love, which imbues the opera with an impalpable vein of melancholy that is distinctively Slavic, fiery but also tempered.
VC Dvořák's Central European nymph lands for the first time at Piermarini’s theatre after more than a century. How might you explain this prolonged absence?
TH The infrequent appearance of Rusalka on Western stages is probably connected to its fleeting nature. We expect the classic happy ending from a fairy tale, but in this “favola lirica”, which is light as far as fairy tales go but bleak as a tragic play, Dvořák contradicts all expectations. Like Friedrich de la Motte Fouqué’s Undine and Hans Christian Andersen’s The Little Mermaid, Rusalka is an aquatic creature that becomes a woman for love. On this premise, however, a psychological story is built (these were the years of Freud, the Vienna Secession and Klimt), one that intersects themes that have nothing to do with fairy tales, like the rejection of self-expression, desire, betrayal and suicide. Naturally, the fantasy emerges because the Symbolist aesthetic owns subject matter with its imagery of magical creatures immersed in the mist and Nordic shadows far from human civilization.
VC Some in the past have accused Rusalka of lacking originality. How would you define it?
TH While the story itself is inspired by an old theme from Romantic literature, the music is beyond original. Dvořák pours all his passion for the woodlands and waters surrounding his home in the countryside into the score, including carefully transforming the spells from Jaroslav Kvapil’s libretto into the exquisite, shimmering musical fabric upon which the voices weave delicate melodies without excluding moments of declamatory and dramatic vocalism. Everything is paired with an admirable degree of care for the orchestral colour, with its clear symphonic stamp. Rusalka is an opera in which the orchestra plays a central role in suggesting the musical drama itself, in skilfully highlighting every nuance. One example is the grand final love duet between the prince and Rusalka. The right combination of sounds is needed to avoid falling into the trap of easy sentimentalism, excessive yearning, a tired cliché.
VC And yet, it’s not lacking references to Wagner on a harmonic level, with chords from Tristan and Isolde and recurring themes, or reminders of Czech folklore…
TH Like most of his late 19th-century contemporaries, Dvořák absorbs the late-Romantic language of his time but dulls the contents to stand firmly in the land of fairy tales rather than myths. An Tristan-Akkord echo can be sensed when the expression of love cries out with greater vehemence, but there’s no direct reference. His inspiration is based also on his contact with the typical songs and dances of the Bohemian peoples. Also here, these are influences that are enclosed in secondary passages (for example the comic scene between the gamekeeper and the kitchen hand at the beginning of Act II), which enrich rather than limit the “new world” of Dvořák harmonies. In this strange opera in which the heroine is mute for much of the three acts (in her “humanization” she lacks the ability to speak), there is a sense of paradox that foreshadows the avant-garde of the beginning of the 20th century.
VC Imprisoned by her muteness, Rusalka pays the price for her choice with betrayal and realizes how false and dishonest the human world is. But is she really an innocent victim?
TH Rusalka is a being between two worlds (the daughter of the water goblin and a woman) who wishes to become completely human in order to be with the prince she is in love with. When the unfaithful young man allows himself to be seduced by the foreign princess, there are devastating effects, but she is not the one who pays with her life; rather the prince will perish in the arms of the girl so that she can be welcomed back to the dreamworld she came from. During the three acts, we see her thinking, choosing, acting and even forgiving. She doesn’t act like a victim subjected to a fate of unhappiness at all. Her message is a powerful one of unconditional love, which finds unspoken meaning in the most intense solitary moments (the anthology piece of “Preghiera alla luna”). For the soprano, who must have excellent acting skills, it is an incredible challenge to juggle hypnotic acting performances with the heart wrenching audaciousness of opera buffa.
VC Rusalka is a score you have been conducting for more than a decade in prestigious European theatres, like Vienna, Copenhagen, Helsinki and Monaco. Which version do you prefer and how has your approach changed over the years?
TH The attitude at the core is the same, but every time I conduct Rusalka, I study it as if it were the first time. The experience I have could drive me to work on “autopilot”, but every production is different, has its direction and requires a certain type of execution depending on the orchestra and singers involved. There are sceneries that change the way the opera is watched, like that of Martin Kušej, who I conducted for recently at Bayerische Staatsoper (for which there is a DVD recording available), in which the innocence of Rusalka is stripped away with crude realism and the spectator is invited to look beyond the fairy tale facade. Others are more traditionalist, offering a less disruptive interpretation. I respect them all without bias. The important thing is that they in turn respect the intimate beauty of this masterpiece.
Valentina Crosetto

# Nicoletta Manni
Nicoletta Manni
![nicoletta Manni ok sito ph Brescia e Amisano ©Teatro alla Scala](/static/upload/nic/nicoletta-manni-ok-sito-ph-brescia-e-amisano--teatro-alla-scala.jpg)
Nata in provincia di Lecce, a 13 anni è ammessa al quarto corso alla Scuola di Ballo dell’Accademia Teatro alla Scala. Nel 2009, dopo essersi diplomata, riceve una proposta di contratto presso lo Staatsballett di Berlino diretta da Vladimir Malakhov, dove lavora per tre stagioni, prendendo parte a tutte le produzioni classiche e contemporanee. Nella primavera 2013 entra a far parte del Corpo di Ballo del Teatro alla Scala e dall’aprile 2014 è Prima ballerina. Partecipa alle produzioni e alle creazioni per la Compagnia, e interpreta i ruoli principali in sede e nel corso delle tournée. Nel suo repertorio le produzioni di Rudolf Nureyev *Il lago dei cigni* (Odette/Odile), *Don Chisciotte* (Regina delle Driadi e Kitri), *la Bella addormentata (*Aurora e Fata principale*);* di George Balanchine *(Jewels -* coppia principale di *Diamonds* e ballerina solista di *Rubies;* *Symphony in C* - secondo movimento e primo movimento; *Sogno di una notte di mezza estate* - Titania e passo a due del secondo atto; *Apollo* -Tersicore; *Lo schiaccianoci* - Fata Confetto), Alexei Ratmansky (coppia in blu in *Russian Seasons* e coppia principale in *Concerto DSCH*; *La bella addormentata nel bosco -* Fata dei Lillà e Aurora; *Il lago dei cigni* - Odette/Odile); Roland Petit (*Pink Floyd Ballet, Le Jeune homme et la Mort)* Kenneth MacMillan *(Romeo e Giulietta e L’histoire de Manon);* Heinz Spoerli *(Cello Suites e Goldberg Variationen); Mauro Bigonzetti (Cinderella -* Fata Madrina e in seguito Cenerentola, *Progetto Händel-* interprete principale); John Cranko (*Onegin*, nel ruolo di Tat’jana); John Neumeier (*La Dame aux camélias* - Manon e Marguerite Gautier). Oltre ad essere protagonista in *Giselle* (Coralli-Perrot ripresa Yvette Chauviré), ha interpretato Clara Nello *Schiaccianoci* di Nacho Duato, la Civiltà in *Excelsior,* la creazione di Massimiliano Volpini il *giardino degli amanti,* La ballerina in *Petruška* di Michail Fokin, *Petite Mort* di Jiří Kylián, Medora per *Le Corsaire* di Anna-Marie Holmes, *Woolf Works* di Wayne McGregor (*Becomings).* Interpreta il ruolo protagonista in *Sylvia* di Manuel Legris, titolo inaugurale della Stagione 2019-2020 di Balletto alla Scala, *Sarcasmen* di Hans van Manen. Nel Gala di Balletto alla Scala (settembre 2020) è interprete di *Carmen* (estratti) dal balletto di Roland Petit. Per la serata “A riveder le stelle” interpreta l’adagio dal Grand Pas de deux di *Lo schiaccianoci* di Nureyev: In “Grandi Momenti di Danza” riprende il ruolo di Kitri nel grand pas de deux dall’atto III di *Don Chisciotte* e in “Omaggio a Nureyev” il ruolo di Dulcinea nel II atto di *Don Chisciotte* e Odile nel passo a tre da *Il Lago dei cigni.* In “Serata Grandi Coreografi” danza il divertissement da *Paquita*. in “Serata Quattro Coreografi” è tra gli interpreti di *Movements to Stravinsky* e riprende *Concerto DSCH.* In „Serata Contemporanea“ è protagonista di *Tristan and Isolde-pas de deux* di Krzysztof Pastor. Per *La bayadère* di Rudolf Nureyev, titolo inaugurale della Stagione 2021-2022, interpreta il ruolo di Nikiya e in *Jewels* di George Balanchine riprende il ruolo nella coppia principale di *Diamonds* e della ballerina solista di *Rubies.* In *Gala Fracci* interpreta il passo a due del terzo atto da *Lo schiaccianoci* di Nureyev e il quarto movimento di *Symphony in C* Per la produzione di Wayne McGregor *AfteRite+LORE* è nel cast di apertura della creazione *LORE* e in seguito anche di *AfteRite.* Debutta nel ruolo di Clara per *Lo schiaccianoci* di Rudolf Nureyev, titolo di apertura della Stagione di Balletto 2022-2023. Nella serata *Dawson/Duato/Kratz/Kylián* è tra i protagonisti di *Anima Animus* (David Dawson) e della creazione *Solitude Sometimes* (Philippe Kratz). In *Le Corsaire* di Manuel Legris interpreta il ruolo di Medora. Per “Serata William Forsythe – Blake Works V” è tra i protagonisti di *The Barre Project.* Nella ripresa di *Romeo e Giulietta* di Kenneth MacMillan del giugno/luglio 2023 torna in scena nel ruolo protagonista di Giulietta. Nel settembre 2023 riprende il ruolo protagonista di Odette/Odile in *Il lago dei cigni*, coreografia di Rudolf Nureyev. In novembre riprende il ruolo di Tat’jana per *Onegin* di John Cranko accanto a Roberto Bolle. Al termine della seconda recita, l’8 novembre, viene annunciata in palcoscenico, dal Sovrintendente e Direttore Artistico Dominique Meyer insieme al Direttore del Ballo Manuel Legris, la sua nomina a étoile. Inaugura la nuova Stagione di Balletto debuttando nel ruolo di Swanilda nella nuova creazione di *Coppélia* di Alexei Ratmansky, Nella terza edizione di Gala Fracci interpreta *La luna* di Maurice Béjart, rimontata per l’occasione da Luciana Savignano, per la quale l’assolo fu creato. Riprende nel maggio/giugno 2024 il ruolo di Nikiya per *La bayadére* di Rudolf Nureyav accanto a Timofej Andrijashenko e all’artista ospite Kimin Kim. Il 2 giugno 2024 riceve l’onorificenza di Ufficiale al merito della Repubblica Italiana. Nella ripresa di *L’histoire de Manon* del luglio 2024 riprende il ruolo protagonista danzando con Reece Clarke, principal del Royal Ballet di Londra.
Nel 2012 ottiene il terzo posto al Premio Roma Danza, in seguito il Premio Danza&Danza come Interprete per la stagione 2014 e viene nominata Danzatore dell’anno 2014 dalla rivista online giornaledelladanza.com. Unica italiana candidata al Premio Benois de la Danse 2015, si è esibita al Teatro Bol’šoj e sempre nel 2015 è nominata “Promessa” della danza dalla rivista specializzata tedesca “Tanz”. Ha danzato come ospite al Balletto del Cremlino di Mosca (*Giselle*), con Asami Maki Ballet di Tokyo (*Notre Dame de Paris* di Roland Petit), Lithuanian National Ballet di Vilnius (*Don Chisciotte*), con il Balletto del Bolshoi a Mosca (La Ballerina in *Etudes* di Harald Lander), ai Gala Dance Open Festival 2017 (San Pietroburgo), Elisa y Amigos 2016 (Messico), All Star Ballet Gala 2017 (Toronto), Yurgita Dronina Ballet world star gala 2015 (Vilnius), Season Opening Gala 2016 (Bucarest), Iana Salenko e le stelle del balletto 2017 (Kiev), "La notte della taranta" a Melpignano, dove ha interpretato la canzone di Yael Deckelbaum ‘The preyers of the mothers’, coreografata da Luciano Cannito. Ballet Gala 2018 (Varsavia), Petipa Methamorphosis XXI century 2018 (San Pietroburgo), Stelle del XXI secolo 2018 (San Pietroburgo) e dal 2014 con Roberto Bolle nel Roberto Bolle & Friends e nei suoi spettacoli televisivi. Nel settembre 2020 riceve il premio “danzatore dell’anno sulla scena internazionale” nella 48 edizione di “Positano premia la danza Léonide Massine”. Riceve il premio Danza&Danza 2023 come “Personaggio dell’anno”. Riceve il premio Danza&Danza 2023 come “Personaggio dell’anno”

# Family box
# Family box
Teatro alla Scala boxes have historically been a privileged gathering place for families, not only the Milanese ones.
With the «Family Box» project, Teatro alla Scala offers a new way to bring younger audiences to the theatre.
A selection of 4-seats boxes will be available specifically for people under 18 years old accompanied by adults with a special price for minors.
These special boxes are sold either as subscriptions or online and at the ticket office as single tickets (at least one minor plus one adult) as soon as the sales for each performance start.

# Partner e Fornitori Ufficiali
# Partner e Fornitori Ufficiali
I Partner Ufficiali della Scala creano con il Teatro un dialogo fondato sul riconoscimento delle rispettive ‘eccellenze’ e sulla condivisione di valori comuni.
Guidati da questo principio, i nostri ‘Partner Ufficiali’, che spesso sono anche ‘Fornitori Ufficiali’, sostengono le produzioni delle Stagioni artistiche del Teatro e le valorizzano, per costruire progetti che diventano elemento chiave della propria comunicazione corporate.
I Partner Ufficiali dimostrano, giorno dopo giorno, di saper andare oltre i propri confini commerciali e di svolgere un ruolo attivo, consapevoli della propria responsabilità sociale.

# "Unveiling inspiration": Pinterest e il Teatro alla Scala raccontano la Prima per immagini
# "Unveiling inspiration": Pinterest e il Teatro alla Scala raccontano la Prima per immagini
La presenza sui social media è stata una costante della strategia di comunicazione del Teatro alla Scala negli ultimi anni. Notizie sulla programmazione, approfondimenti sui titoli in programma, immagini dalle prove e dal backstage e memorie della tradizione scaligera hanno portato i canali del Teatro a raggiungere i 441.500 follower su Facebook, 357.000 su Instagram e 307.000 su Twitter, mentre è aperto ormai da due anni il canale TikTok.
In occasione dell’anteprima Under30 e del 7 dicembre 2023 il Teatro ha avviato un nuovo progetto con Pinterest, la piattaforma dedicata alla condivisione di immagini.
“[Unveiling inspiration](https://www.pinterest.it/teatroallascala/don-carlo-prima-scala-unveiling-inspiration/)” offrirà agli utenti Pinterest un’esperienza immersiva della Serata inaugurale del Teatro alla Scala. Attraverso una serie di video sulla piattaforma, Pinterest offrirà agli amanti dell’arte di tutto il mondo l’opportunità di dare uno sguardo dietro le quinte della realizzazione di uno dei momenti culturali più iconici dell’anno: la Prima. Tutti i contenuti saranno pubblicati sul profilo Pinterest del Teatro alla Scala, in collaborazione con la Creator Valentina Raso e saranno mostrati nella Daily inspiration Tab della piattaforma in tutta Europa. Questa nuova serie con il Teatro alla Scala dimostra l’impegno costante di Pinterest nel portare contenuti straordinari agli oltre 480 milioni di utenti che ogni mese si rivolgono alla piattaforma per cercare ispirazione.

# Progetti Artistici Speciali
# Progetti Artistici Speciali
Ogni anno, in ciascuna Stagione artistica, la Direzione Marketing del Teatro costruisce con nuovi Partner progetti ad hoc, legati a un evento o ciclo di eventi artistici.
Il progetto può essere finalizzato a celebrare momenti speciali/anniversari, sviluppare attività di co-marketing e public relations, riposizionare brand o valorizzare specificità comuni a due ambiti apparentemente diversi, ma nella realtà affini per condivisione di valori.
**Per informazioni**
Francesca Agus

# One step from Eden on Earth 
# One step from Eden on Earth 
## Ever since her Rossinian debut in *Cinderella* in 2001, Joyce DiDonato has been one of the most beloved mezzo-sopranos by the Scala audience. Her performance of Eden retraces five centuries of music history.
![EDEN02 2579](/static/upload/ede/eden02_2579.jpg)
Even a voice that masters the great Baroque repertoire (as Joyce DiDonato recently demonstrated in Theodora at La Scala) knows you can’t live only by the past. This is where Eden comes from. The album encompasses a range of music that covers almost half a millennium, from Biagio Marini to the contemporary composer Rachel Portman, and it has been transformed into a global tour, embellished by projects that raise awareness for environmental issues. It is the portrait of a mezzo-soprano activist who will present the results of the project through pieces by Gluck, Händel and Mahler, introduced by Charles Ives’ enigmatic “The Unanswered Question”, in her show on June 23 at La Scala. The evening will support the Fondazione Francesca Rava.
LB: Ms. DiDonato, take us on a journey through your Eden.
JD: The seed that inspired it was a quote from playwright Jonathan Larson: “The opposite of war isn’t peace, it’s creation.” This program contains masterpieces that span centuries (like the aria “Toglierò le sponde al mare” from Mysliveček’s Adamo ed Eva alongside “Nature, the gentlest mother” by Aaron Copland), which invite us to connect more deeply with the world we live in. The symbolic ambition is to plant and nurture a new garden.
LB: Is that why you give away seeds at every stop on your tour?
JD: We have given out 44,000 “seed cards” in more than 27 cities. By the time we arrive at La Scala, it will be almost 70,000. The beautiful thing is that in every single city, I noticed incredibly active and engaged listening. And I would not want to forget the presence of the Children’s Choir, children being Eden incarnate, a gift of living hope. It is without a doubt the greatest project of my career.
LB: Eden seems to be a new manifesto of today’s singer. It is not just well-sung arias but music that “serves” society.
JD: We are fundamentally disconnected in today’s world. It’s as if we are unconsciously looking for more and more noise to placate ourselves, to eliminate the questions we hold inside. Naturally, those of us who love music perhaps already have an ear for listening more deeply, but I see a nihilist tendency, also in the music industry, and I would like to try to eradicate it. If we listen to “As with Rosy steps the morn” and we are incredibly moved by the peace and sense of profound, well-deserved hope that the aria awakens in us, then it is our individual responsibility to keep that awareness alive. We cannot simply exit and immediately succumb to the desperation and chaos outside. On the contrary, we are called to carry with us the hope that the composer, librettist and performers have given us.
LB: What hope did you have when you debuted at La Scala?
JD: If I’m being honest, I was incredibly nervous but perfectly prepared. I was singing in the second cast of Cenerentola directed by Bruno Campanella. I was worried about being booed, so I mentally prepared when I made my first appearance (with my back to the audience while they ground the coffee). I was ready for the worst. But instead, the magic seemed to overcome me, and that evening I truly felt like Cinderella. I will never forget when, just before the final aria “Non più mesta”, the great Michele Pertusi, who was playing Alidoro, took my hand and said, “Have fun!” I sang to the best of my ability, with Maestro Campanella smiling from ear to ear. The audience erupted with applause, and I fell in love forever with this incredible theatre. Unforgettable.
LB: Your home is at the Metropolitan Opera in New York, a theatre that is focusing heavily on contemporary titles.
JD: I will open the season at the Met in September with Dead Man Walking by Jake Heggie. I have sung it a couple of times and can say without hesitation that it is the most profound theatrical experience I have ever had. I think the key is in finding pieces that allow the voice to take off and highlight the depth of emotion of the characters and tell a story that truly matters. We might not always do a good job (even Mozart missed the bullseye a few times!), but the reward lies in being able to leave our collective mark for future generations.
LB: You dedicate a lot of time to the development of young, talented singers. What type of teacher are you?
JD: I am very demanding, but always from a supportive and not destructive standpoint. When I was younger, I suffered from a humiliating and dismissive form of teaching, and I would never dream of inflicting that on someone else. Singers have so much to process, navigate and understand that they certainly don’t need insults to get better. But my standards are incredibly high, and I almost immediately know how far I can go with a specific singer. Ultimately, the best students are those who aren’t defensive because they are more open and willing to grow to expand their talent.
LB: You sang and often sing also in places that have been forgotten by music, like prisons.
JD: Those were the most profound experiences I have had in music. I don’t think it would be out of place to say that, although wonderful, opera lovers often have impossible standards for you to reach. And I understand only to a certain extent because we must give ourselves the chance to fail, to take risks, to explore, to grow. But few singers feel free to do so for fear of not meeting the expectations of the industry. When I perform Händel, Mahler or Rossini at a prison where there is no context or recording to refer to, people react with pure instinct, viscerally experiencing the thrill and the profound emotions of the human voice.
LB: Can you share your most recent experience?
JD: In December, I was at Sing Sing maximum-security prison. I sang “Ombra mai fu”, a piece that closes Eden. To those listening, I simply said, “It’s a pretty silly song. It is only about someone who appreciates the shade of a tree. Usually, opera has more passion and drama. But, even if it is silly, I think that you will be amazed by its beauty.” When I finished singing, a young man in the first row raised his hand and said, “Miss Joyce, I don’t want to be disrespectful, but I don’t think that song is silly. I would give anything to sit under a tree like that right now.”
LB: Have you managed to get your unconventional audience to sing?
JD: Of course. Once, three men joined me in singing “Pur ti miro.” They told me they had saved up to by the CD, they learned Italian, and we performed together in front of 150 people. This is why we must be bold and bring music to the hearts of those who need it.
Luca Baccolini

# Partner Museo Teatrale
Oltre 250.000 turisti provenienti da ogni parte del mondo visitano ogni anno il Museo della Scala, memoria storica del Teatro dalla sua nascita fino ai giorni nostri. Come partner del Museo Teatrale e delle sue Mostre Temporanee, le aziende hanno l’opportunità unica di associare il proprio nome alla storia del Teatro alla Scala.
